results:
Based on my search, here's what I found about "The Peasants" (2023) film regarding its box office performance in Poland, IMDb rating, and Rotten Tomatoes reviews:

## Box Office Performance in Poland

With over 1.5 million admissions, "The Peasants" is the most successful Polish film of 2023 and landed in fourth place overall at the national box office. The film opened in local theatres on 13 October, surpassing 1.5 million tickets sold.

## IMDb Rating

The film has an IMDb rating of 7.6/10, indicating strong audience reception.

## Rotten Tomatoes Reviews

On Rotten Tomatoes, the film holds an approval rating of 60% based on 65 reviews, with an average rating of 6.3/10. The critical consensus reads: "The Peasants is a tremendous visual achievement, although the story may be disappointingly conventional in comparison."

## Additional Review Information

Metacritic assigned the film a score of 61 out of 100, based on 17 critics, indicating "generally favorable" reviews. In Poland, according to the review aggregator Mediakrytyk, the film was "very positively reviewed and acclaimed by critics".

The film is notable for its unique painted animation technique, where 127 artists painted "40,000 frames of oil paintings" and the process "took three years to paint and animate". It's an adaptation of Władysław Reymont's Nobel Prize-winning novel and was directed by DK Welchman and Hugh Welchman, the same team behind "Loving Vincent."
